com.sap.conn.jco.ms

Interface JCoMessageServer


  • public interface JCoMessageServer
    The JCoMessageServer interface is the entry point for accessing the technical information of an ABAP system. It provides all information needed for defining the technical configuration for a JCoDestination of an ABAP system, which makes it comfortable to implement a wizard for defining a destination. It provides a list of both JCoApplicationServer and JCoLogonGroup and message server specific data. A specific instance can be retrieved from the JCoMessageServerFactory.
    Since:
    JCo 3.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<JCoApplicationServer> getApplicationServers()
      Returns the list of application servers belonging to the ABAP system.
      String getHostName()
      Returns the host name of the message server.
      List<JCoLogonGroup> getLogonGroups()
      Returns the list of logon groups available for the ABAP system.
      String getName()
      Returns the name of the message server in the list of message servers managed by the implementation of MessageServerDataProvider.
      String getSAPRouterString()
      Returns the SAProuter string needed for reaching the message server or null if none is needed.
      String getServiceName()
      Returns the service name associated with the message server.
      String getServicePort()
      Returns the service port associated with the message server.
      String getSystemId()
      Returns the system ID of the ABAP system, the message server belongs to.
      void refresh()
      Allows to refresh the information about logon groups and application servers.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the message server in the list of message servers managed by the implementation of MessageServerDataProvider.
        Returns:
        the name of the message server

      • getSystemId

        String getSystemId()
        Returns the system ID of the ABAP system, the message server belongs to.
        Returns:
        the system ID of the ABAP system

      • getHostName

        String getHostName()
        Returns the host name of the message server.
        Returns:
        the host name of the message server.

      • getServiceName

        String getServiceName()
        Returns the service name associated with the message server. This is the default logical port defined in /etc/services, which is sapms<systemID>
        Returns:
        the service name associated with the message server.

      • getServicePort

        String getServicePort()
        Returns the service port associated with the message server. This is either the default logical port defined in /etc/services, which is sapms<systemID> or the true port provided in the configuration.
        Returns:
        the service port associated with the message server.

      • getSAPRouterString

        String getSAPRouterString()
        Returns the SAProuter string needed for reaching the message server or null if none is needed.
        Returns:
        the SAProuter string needed for reaching the message server or null if none is needed.

      • getLogonGroups

        List<JCoLogonGroup> getLogonGroups()
        Returns the list of logon groups available for the ABAP system.
        Returns:
        the list of logon groups available for the ABAP system.

      • getApplicationServers

        List<JCoApplicationServer> getApplicationServers()
        Returns the list of application servers belonging to the ABAP system.
        Returns:
        the list of application servers belonging to the ABAP system.

      • refresh

        void refresh()
      throws MessageServerQueryException
        Allows to refresh the information about logon groups and application servers. Calling this API will trigger a call to the message server (if data is considered outdated) and will update the list of logon groups and of application servers to the latest state. When retrieving a JCoMessageServer from the JCoMessageServerFactory, a refresh will be executed automatically.
        Throws:
        MessageServerQueryException - in case the query to the message server is failing
